title: Techguysally
author: Techguysally
content: My fellow folks they way things and such activities happening in this country today, what do you think changing our leaders will make it better and right ? To my own opinion and perception they problem of this country is within us, if we continue to change leadership, it will never end until we change our own selves.This can be refer to the word of the almighty, where he said."We choose a leader among you, someone with the same character as you are". So when the masses decide to make the change within themselves then a change will be selected for us.A human being can make rain drops, a human being can create a change but Only The almighty can relieve a society from its calamity, and this can only be done If the society decided to change there ways... take for example this CBN policy is a good one by the government and CBN but the implementation process lack merit by alot of bankers and bank managers.Because money were kept for politicians and even d one available in the banking system they are trying to do business with it.Today,the people aspiring for office today in Nigeria, they are the same people over and over again... So we don't expect a different approach if the circle or let me say the table remains the same..How will the society get it right:By bringing the unknown, there are many people out there that are blessed with our progress, but they are being drive the opportunity due to financial crises, some have try their best and are in a party we can say as party without structure.. those people that we don't know or we believe they can't win, are the change i believe the society need. But is the dweller's of the society ready to make this change?Untill we change this our believe of jumping from this one to that one, and seat down to decide for ourselves, that's when we will get it right, and have a leader that will bring that change.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Your topic is similar to these. And as such, they should merge together.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439741.0Change starts with us; even if we have change within us without good leaders, the change won't reflect more, so we need both good leaders and us to change in order to make this country better. We can choose our preferred leader by voting this time, and I believe if we vote right, we will eventually see change in the coming years.

comments.body: Yeah I think change of leaders is another way God will use in helping Nigeria,we have lived in 8 good years with one presidential authority,moving out from it is a new beginning to success,I must say I miss Our former president Godluck Jonathan alot ,but any ways peter obi is coming ,David Lyon is coming too ,other good things are coming also .we really need to pray this season because things are becoming hot

comments.body: Yes I strongly believe that changes leadership can make Nigeria better,in the sense that whenever a man who was choose by the most high God is on the throne, think will start moving well gradually, because they said that charity begins at home,when the leaders is good then the mases will be afraid of commiting crime,but in a situation where by the leaders are the sponsors of evil, corruption, kidnapping etc,they what do you expect from your flowers to do in other to survive in a country like that..

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: The answer to this question is both Yes and No..I say "Yes" because if we successfully re-elect a visionary leader who has strategic plans on how to tackle all the problems we are facing in this country, then such will make Nigeria better. And I will also say "No" because of by mistake we happens to vote a leader who has totally nothing to offer (I.e only dance during campaigns without saying anything tangible) then this country will go from bad to worst. And unfortunately, tomorrow is the day for us to vote that leader that will change the narrative of our nation Nigeria, and you know who that person is.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Techguysally on February 18, 2023, 07:21:31 AMMy fellow folks they way things and such activities happening in this country today, what do you think changing our leaders will make it better and right ? To my own opinion and perception they problem of this country is within us, if we continue to change leadership, it will never end until we change our own selves..Irrespective of who turns out the winner of today's election, I think the leadership will be different form what Buhari and APC had put us through. If Peter OBI wins, his leadership will be of a great impact in the economy of the country as things will be done differently. If Tinubu wins I believe things will be different as well. We mightn't have a vibrant president but his ideologies when implemented might get us something closer to what the lagosians are enjoying in regards to development coming into the state.If Atiku wins, we all know he's industrious and companies will be interested in coming to the country since his style of leadership will always favor them. The three presidential candidate has a positive attributes and I think this is the first time we are experiencing such quality in our candidates. The only thing wey spoil this election na say some dun old well well pass the others and make no body convince you none of them is a youth. Make we dey watch.

comments.author: Justtoons
comments.body: Nigeria as we all know, is a great nation because of it's riches in both minerals and resources. Recently, Nigeria has suffered too many economic down growth and this has brought about inflation in the country. The current government of Nigeria, has failed to carry out it's duties to improve the economy of the country. So a change of government will be the right thing to do so the country can improve economically. As at yesterday, Nigerians went out to vote for their next leaders and we all pray that the right one is voted for because it will do a great change for it's people.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Psalms 23:1: "The Lord is my shepherd, and I shall not want." Imagine being a shepherd and allowing your sheep to go astray; some of those sheep will become lost and may be eaten by wild animals. Let's now equate citizens and leaders. If you allow your citizens to suffer, where their opinion does not really matter to you, what do you expect them to do? (as a citizen) a country where you are being denied your vote and being detected as to whom to vote for, where you have your money in the bank but cannot collect it, where you have to stay under long lines and under the sun just to get your own country's identity card.Where are these problems coming from?It's not easy to control human beings, but good leaders have got to set examples that citizens can follow, make things easy for citizens, and hear out their opinions too. Go on TikTok and search for election updates, and you will see some violent videos. Tell me, how can you be scared of going out to vote because of these violent incidents? In a video I saw, a lady almost got blinded just to vote. Is it also the fault of the citizens that the current president is unable to ensure a peaceful election in all states? How many soldiers does the country have? Can't they appoint squads of soldiers to guide all the voting units? Good leaders can also determine good citizens. just my opinion.watch this: https://imgur.com/a/Muo8oxW

The reason why the nation be as e be today na because of the corruption of the leaders them and watin go still make am better na still those leaders them. If people no too dey suffer, them no go reason do them neighbours bad thing! Abi you no think  like that? Na so e just be.

comments.author: Alphakilo
comments.body: With the current situation in Nigeria, I strongly believe that changing of leader will make Nigeria better than it was. Not just changing leader but changing a leader who has the country at heart, a leader who is not self centered, someone who is not tribalistic or so religious. Though it will be so difficult to figure out a leader with these qualities but we can achieve this by looking back at the impact they have created in their various states because charity begins at home. In my conclusion, changing of leader will help make a better Nigeria.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: While it is true that everything rises and falls on leadership, as John Maxwell said in one of his books, I would say that I strongly believe that you need followers with a reformed mind to be able to make the right choice of a leader. These statements are in agreement with what some of the other users have said.For example, in the just-concluded presidential elections, we could see that we have Nigerians who still love their slave masters and would go to any length to sell, betray, and even kill their own just for personal gains and greed. After watching all of these scenarios, I came to the unmistakable conclusion that our problem is a people problem, not a leadership problem. And because leaders are also people, you need people whose mindsets have been reformed, or transformed to be able to hold leadership positions. This is the point on which I stand.

comments.author: SOKO-DEKE
comments.body: The things that are happening to us in this country are all the fault of bad leaders who lack the ambition to lead. Surely, if the power were in the hands of leaders with good ambitions, Nigeria would improve. Because it is only leaders that have power to decide how the country will be run, many of the countries we observe that are doing better are it is as a result leaders. Therefore, whether in communities or nations, changing a leadership is always play a very important rules. And for my own view, I believe that Nigerians need a change of leaders in order to have better hope, as we don't think that the formal leaders we currently have can give us any new hope, so we need to change and see what will happen,that is how we keep trying till we get the good once.
